title: Ram purchased an item at 3200 Rupees after getting 2 successive discounts of 20%.How much more would he have saved, if he had got a flat discount of 40%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Suppose, marked price of that item = m rupees. So, m * {1 - (20 / 100)} * {1 - (20 / 100)} = 3200 m * 0.8 * 0.8 = 3200 m = (3200 / 0.64) = 5000 Had it been there a flat 40% discount; Ram would have purchased the item for [5000 * {1 - (40 / 100)}] rupees = 3000 rupees. And, in this case, Ram would have saved (3200 - 3000) rupees = 200 rupees.

Purchesed price Rs 3200 after getting 20% discount , so (100–20)=80% of before discount puice is Rs 3200 Before discount price = (3200/80)×100=4000 Rs 4000 is the 20% discount price of original price .So Rs 4000 is the 80% of the original price. So, original price = (4000/80)×100= Rs5000 If one time discount was 40% then selling price will be 5000–[ (5000/100)×40] = (5000–2000) = Rs 3000 So Ram can be saved 3200–3000=Rs 200
